## 3. Data Cleaning

### a. Demographics/Characteristics

```{r}

data$gender <- as.factor(data$gender)
data$gender

data$age <- as.factor(data$age)
data$age

data <- data%>%
  mutate(id= row_number())

data <- data %>%
  mutate(yrs_combine = recode(
    yrs_teach,
    "0-1 years" = "0-5 years",
    "2-5 years" = "0-5 years",
    "6-10 years" = "6-10 years",
    "11-15 years" = "11+ years",
    "More than 15 years" = "11+ years",
    .default ="Unknown"  # Change as necessary for unmatched values
  ))

data
```

### b. Measure Cleaning

#### i. Emotional Regulation Questionnaire (ERQ)

```{r}
erq_data_recode <- data %>%
  mutate(across(starts_with("er"), ~ case_when(.== "Strongly disagree" ~ 1,
                                               .=="Disagree" ~ 2,
                                               .=="Somewhat disagree" ~ 3,
                                               .=="Neither agree nor disagree (neutral)" ~ 4,
                                               .=="Somewhat agree" ~ 5,
                                               .=="Agree" ~ 6,
                                               .=="Strongly agree" ~ 7,
                                               .== "" ~ NA_real_)))

pro_data_recode <- erq_data_recode %>%
  mutate(across(starts_with("pro"), ~ case_when(.=="Never" ~ 1,
                                               .=="Rarely" ~ 2,
                                               .=="Sometimes" ~ 3,
                                               .=="Often" ~ 4,
                                               .=="Very often" ~ 5,
                                               .== "" ~ NA_real_)))

final_data <- pro_data_recode %>%
  mutate(across(starts_with("mhl"), ~ case_when(.== "Strongly disagree" ~ 1,
                                               .=="Disagree" ~ 2,
                                               .=="Somewhat disagree" ~ 3,
                                               .=="Somewhat agree" ~ 4,
                                               .=="Agree" ~ 5,
                                               .=="Strongly agree" ~ 6,
                                               .== "" ~ NA_real_)))



final_data<- final_data %>%
  mutate(mean_mhl_id = ((mhl_1 + mhl_2 + mhl_3 + mhl_4 + mhl_5 + mhl_6 + mhl_7 + mhl_8 + mhl_9 + mhl_10 + mhl_11 + mhl_11 + mhl_12 + mhl_13 + mhl_14 + mhl_15)/15))

final_data
```

### Comment: I love the way you coded reveresely. But have you thought about encapsulating the reversal logic in a reusable function and apply it dynamically:

# Function to reverse scores
reverse_scores <- function(data, vars) {
  data %>%
    mutate(across(all_of(vars), ~ as.numeric(recode(.,
      `1` = "5", `2` = "4", `3` = "3", `4` = "2", `5` = "1"
    ))))
}

# Reverse specific items
final_data <- reverse_scores(final_data, c("pro_1", "pro_2", "pro_15", "pro_17", "pro_29"))

#Step 2 Compassion Satisfaction

#add scores on 3, 6, 12, 16, 18, 20, 22, 24, 27, 30

final_data <- final_data %>%
  mutate(sum_comp_satis = (pro_3 + pro_6 + pro_12 + pro_16 + pro_18 + pro_20 + pro_22 + pro_24 + pro_27 + pro_30))

# Step 3 Burnout

final_data

# Plot 3

```{r}
#Research question 3: is there a relationship between teacher mental health efficacy and burnout? X = mental health efficacy, Y = burnout, scatter plot + line

final_data %>%
  ggplot(aes(mean_mhl_id, sum_burnout)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth() +
  ggtitle("Teacher Burnout by Mental Health Efficacy") +
  xlab("Mental Health Efficacy") +
  ylab("Burnout")+
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))


### Comment: I love the way you guys adjust the element text. I learned a new thing about ggplot! I have tried the next plot code, hope you like it. 

final_data %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = mean_mhl_id, y = sum_burnout)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.7, color = "blue", size = 2) +  # Add transparency and color
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = TRUE, color = "red") +  # Explicit method for trend line
  ggtitle("Teacher Burnout by Mental Health Efficacy") +
  xlab("Mental Health Efficacy Score") +
  ylab("Burnout Level") +
  theme_minimal() +  # Use a clean theme
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 14, face = "bold"),  # Enhance title
    axis.title = element_text(size = 12),  # Customize axis labels
    axis.text = element_text(size = 10)  # Adjust axis tick text size
  )


```
